com.remote.remote2d.engine.art

Class Renderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.remote.remote2d.engine.art.Renderer

  • public class Renderer
extends java.lang.Object
    A universal renderer class. This is used to abstract out all of the annoying GL11 calls, and consolidates them into one line. This is also useful to do any widespread changes to the render system (switching core libraries, or OpenGL versions). TODO: Update from old OpenGL to new OpenGL.
    Author:
    Flafla2

      static void startScissor(Vector2 pos, Vector2 dim)
      Handles the use of GL11.glScissor(int, int, int, int) while taking into account platform independence features which would otherwise mess up glScissor.

    • Method Detail

      • drawCircleHollow

        public static void drawCircleHollow(Vector2 center,
                    float radius,
                    int sides,
                    float red,
                    float green,
                    float blue,
                    float alpha)
        Draws an approximation of a circle out of lines (Wireframe) with the given amount of sides.
        Parameters:
        center - Center of the circle
        radius - Radius of the circle
        sides - How many sides the circle has (infinite sides are obviously not possible)
        red - Red value, (0.0-1.0)
        green - Green value, (0.0-1.0)
        blue - Blue value, (0.0-1.0)
        alpha - Alpha (opaque) value, (0.0-1.0)
        See Also:
        drawCircleHollow(Vector2, float, int, int, float)

      • drawCircleHollow

        public static void drawCircleHollow(Vector2 center,
                    float radius,
                    int sides,
                    int color,
                    float alpha)
        Draws an approximation of a circle out of lines (Wireframe) with the given amount of sides.
        Parameters:
        center - Center of the circle
        radius - Radius of the circle
        sides - How many sides the circle has (infinite sides are obviously not possible)
        color - Color in hex (0x000000-0xffffff)
        alpha - Alpha (opaque) value, (0.0-1.0)
        See Also:
        drawCircleHollow(Vector2, float, int, float, float, float, float)

                 Vector2 dim,
                 float red,
                 float green,
                 float blue,
                 float alpha)
        Draws a rectangle with an X inside of it. Mostly Used for debugging purposes.
        Parameters:
        pos - Top left corner of the rectangle
        dim - Dimensions of the rectangle
        red - Red value, (0.0-1.0)
        green - Green value, (0.0-1.0)
        blue - Blue value, (0.0-1.0)
        alpha - Alpha (opaque) value, (0.0-1.0)
        See Also:

      • drawLinePoly

        public static void drawLinePoly(Vector2[] vectors,
                float red,
                float green,
                float blue,
                float alpha)
        Draws a polygon out of lines (wireframe) using the given coordinates. The polygon must be convex. Note that this is relatively very slow compared to quads/triangles due to the fact that it uses GL11.GL_POLYGON.
        Parameters:
        vectors - Each vertex of the polygon, in a clockwise direction.
        red - Red value, (0.0-1.0)
        green - Green value, (0.0-1.0)
        blue - Blue value, (0.0-1.0)
        alpha - Alpha (opaque) value, (0.0-1.0)
        See Also:
        drawPoly(Vector2[], Vector2[], Texture, float, float, float, float), drawPoly(Vector2[], float, float, float, float), drawLinePoly(Vector2[], int, float)

      • drawLinePoly

        public static void drawLinePoly(Vector2[] verts,
                int color,
                float alpha)
        Draws a polygon out of lines (wireframe) using the given coordinates. The polygon must be convex. Note that this is relatively very slow compared to quads/triangles due to the fact that it uses GL11.GL_POLYGON.
        Parameters:
        verts - Each vertex of the polygon, in a clockwise direction.
        color - Color in hex (0x000000-0xffffff)
        alpha - Alpha (opaque) value, (0.0-1.0)
        See Also:
        drawPoly(Vector2[], Vector2[], Texture, float, float, float, float), drawPoly(Vector2[], float, float, float, float), drawLinePoly(Vector2[], int, float)

      • drawPoly

        public static void drawPoly(Vector2[] vectors,
            float red,
            float green,
            float blue,
            float alpha)
        Draws a polygon using the given coordinates. The polygon must be convex. Note that this is relatively very slow compared to quads/triangles due to the fact that it uses GL11.GL_POLYGON.
        Parameters:
        vectors - Each vertex of the polygon, in a clockwise direction.
        red - Red value, (0.0-1.0)
        green - Green value, (0.0-1.0)
        blue - Blue value, (0.0-1.0)
        alpha - Alpha (opaque) value, (0.0-1.0)
        See Also:
        drawPoly(Vector2[], Vector2[], Texture, float, float, float, float), drawLinePoly(Vector2[], int, float), drawLinePoly(Vector2[], float, float, float, float)

      • drawPoly

        public static void drawPoly(Vector2[] vectors,
            Vector2[] uv,
            Texture tex,
            float red,
            float green,
            float blue,
            float alpha)
        Draws a polygon using the given coordinates. The polygon must be convex. Note that this is relatively very slow compared to quads/triangles due to the fact that it uses GL11.GL_POLYGON.
        Parameters:
        vectors - Each vertex of the polygon, in a clockwise direction.
        uv - UV coordinates of each vertex
        tex - Texture to use
        red - Red value, (0.0-1.0)
        green - Green value, (0.0-1.0)
        blue - Blue value, (0.0-1.0)
        alpha - Alpha (opaque) value, (0.0-1.0)
        See Also:
        drawPoly(Vector2[], float, float, float, float), drawLinePoly(Vector2[], int, float), drawLinePoly(Vector2[], float, float, float, float)

      • drawRect

        public static void drawRect(Vector2 pos,
            Vector2 dim,
            Vector2 uvPos,
            Vector2 uvDim,
            Texture tex,
            float red,
            float green,
            float blue,
            float alpha)
        Draws a rectangle.
        Parameters:
        pos - Top left corner of the rectangle
        dim - Dimensions of the rectangle
        uvPos - Top left corner of the UV coordinates (0.0-1.0) on X and Y axis
        uvDim - Dimensions of the UV coordinates (0.0-1.0)
        tex - Texture to use
        red - Red value, (0.0-1.0)
        green - Green value, (0.0-1.0)
        blue - Blue value, (0.0-1.0)
        alpha - Alpha (opaque) value, (0.0-1.0).
        See Also:
        drawRect(Vector2, Vector2, int, float), drawRect(Vector2, Vector2, Texture, int, float), drawRect(Vector2, Vector2, float, float, float, float), drawRect(Vector2, Vector2, Texture, float, float, float, float), drawRect(Vector2, Vector2, Vector2, Vector2, Texture, int, float)

      • drawRect

        public static void drawRect(Vector2 pos,
            Vector2 dim,
            Vector2 uvPos,
            Vector2 uvDim,
            Texture tex,
            int color,
            float alpha)
        Draws a rectangle.
        Parameters:
        pos - Top left corner of the rectangle
        dim - Dimensions of the rectangle
        uvPos - Top left corner of the UV coordinates (0.0-1.0) on X and Y axis
        uvDim - Dimensions of the UV coordinates (0.0-1.0)
        tex - Texture to use
        color - Color in hex (0x000000-0xffffff)
        alpha - Alpha (opaque) value, (0.0-1.0).
        See Also:
        drawRect(Vector2, Vector2, int, float), drawRect(Vector2, Vector2, Texture, int, float), drawRect(Vector2, Vector2, float, float, float, float), drawRect(Vector2, Vector2, Texture, float, float, float, float), drawRect(Vector2, Vector2, Vector2, Vector2, Texture, float, float, float, float)

      • endScissor

        public static void endScissor()
        Ends any current scissor. In its current this is identical to GL11.glDisable(GL11.GL_SCISSOR_TEST);, however it is reccommended to use this instead for more control over rendering.

      • isWireframe

        public static boolean isWireframe()
        If the Renderer is currently in wireframe mode.

      • setWireframe

        public static void setWireframe(boolean wireframe)
        Toggles wireframe mode. Note that this only works when using a render call from Renderer.

      • startScissor

        public static void startScissor(Vector2 pos,
                Vector2 dim)
        Handles the use of GL11.glScissor(int, int, int, int) while taking into account platform independence features which would otherwise mess up glScissor.
        Parameters:
        pos - Top left corner of scissor box
        dim - Dimensions of scissor box
        See Also:
        GL11.glScissor(int, int, int, int)
